ab.p:
It was noon when I arrived at the
top of the ascent. For some time I
sat upon the rock that overlooks
the sea of ice. A mist covered both
that and the surrounding untains
Presently a breeze dissipated the mist
and I descended on the glacier.
– The surface is very uneven
rising like the waves of a troubled sea,
decending low, & interspered by rifts
that sink deep— The field of
ice is a league,^in width, but I was
nearly two hours in crossing it – The oppo
